intro: Corydalis turtschaninovii subsp. vernyi, commonly known as the Tibetan Corydalis, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayas and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes at high elevations. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with two lower petals that are often spurred. The subspecies vernyi is distinguished by its specific morphology and geographic distribution compared to other Corydalis species.
